faqItems.question: Is ZeitPal really free?
faqItems.answer: Yes! ZeitPal is completely free for teams up to 20 employees. No credit card required, no hidden costs. You only pay when you grow beyond 20 team members.

faqItems.question: How long does setup take?
faqItems.answer: Most teams are up and running in under 15 minutes. Sign up, invite your team, and go.

faqItems.question: Is ZeitPal GDPR compliant?
faqItems.answer: Yes, ZeitPal is fully GDPR compliant. Your data is stored on German servers and we only process necessary data.

faqItems.question: What absence types are supported?
faqItems.answer: Vacation, sick leave, child sick leave, parental leave, maternity leave, special leave, overtime compensation, training, and unpaid leave.

faqItems.question: Are German holidays included?
faqItems.answer: Yes, ZeitPal knows all German holidays by state. Work days are automatically calculated correctly.

faqItems.question: Can I migrate from Excel to ZeitPal?
faqItems.answer: Absolutely! We help you import your existing leave data. Contact us for support.

termsOfServiceContent.intro: Welcome to ZeitPal. By using our services, you agree to these Terms of Service.

sections.title: 1. Scope
sections.content: These Terms of Service apply to all users of the ZeitPal platform. By registering and using our services, you accept these terms in full.

sections.title: 2. Service Description
sections.content: ZeitPal provides cloud-based software for managing leave requests, absences, and team calendars. The scope of features depends on the selected plan.

sections.title: 3. Registration and User Account
sections.content: Registration is required to use ZeitPal. You are obligated to provide accurate information and keep your login credentials confidential. You are responsible for all activities that occur under your account.

sections.title: 4. Free Usage and Paid Plans
sections.content: ZeitPal is free for teams up to 20 members. For larger teams, our paid plans apply according to the current pricing on our website.

sections.title: 5. User Obligations
sections.content: You agree not to use ZeitPal for unlawful purposes, not to upload harmful content, and to respect the rights of third parties. Sharing login credentials with unauthorized third parties is prohibited.

sections.title: 6. Data Protection
sections.content: Protecting your data is important to us. Details about the processing of personal data can be found in our Privacy Policy.

sections.title: 7. Availability
sections.content: We strive to maintain high availability of our services but cannot guarantee 100% uptime. Maintenance work will be announced in advance when possible.

sections.title: 8. Limitation of Liability
sections.content: ZeitPal is only liable for damages caused by intentional or grossly negligent conduct. Liability for slight negligence is excluded to the extent permitted by law. This does not apply to damages arising from injury to life, body, or health.

sections.title: 9. Termination
sections.content: You may terminate your account at any time. For paid plans, the agreed notice period applies. After termination, your data will be deleted in accordance with our Privacy Policy.

sections.title: 10. Changes to Terms of Service
sections.content: We reserve the right to modify these Terms of Service. You will be notified of material changes by email. Continued use after the changes take effect constitutes acceptance.

sections.title: 11. Applicable Law and Jurisdiction
sections.content: German law applies, excluding the UN Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods. The place of jurisdiction for all disputes is, to the extent permitted by law, the registered office of the operator.

sections.title: 12. Contact
sections.content: If you have questions about these Terms of Service, please contact us via our contact form or by email.

privacyPolicyContent.intro: Protecting your personal data is important to us. This Privacy Policy informs you about how we collect, process, and protect your data.

sections.title: 1. Data Controller
sections.content: The data controller within the meaning of the GDPR is the operator of ZeitPal. Contact details can be found in our Imprint.

sections.title: 2. Collection and Processing of Personal Data
sections.content: We collect personal data when you register with ZeitPal, use our services, or contact us. This includes: name, email address, company data, leave requests, and absence data.

sections.title: 3. Purposes of Data Processing
sections.content: We process your data to provide our services, manage your user account, communicate with you, improve our services, and fulfill legal obligations.

sections.title: 4. Legal Basis
sections.content: Processing is based on Art. 6(1)(b) GDPR (contract performance), Art. 6(1)(a) GDPR (consent), Art. 6(1)(c) GDPR (legal obligation), or Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR (legitimate interests).

sections.title: 5. Data Sharing with Third Parties
sections.content: We only share your data when necessary for contract performance, when you have consented, or when legally required. Our hosting providers are carefully selected and contractually obligated to comply with GDPR.

sections.title: 6. Data Storage and Deletion
sections.content: Your data is stored on servers in Germany. We only store your data for as long as necessary for the respective purposes or as required by legal retention obligations.

sections.title: 7. Your Rights
sections.content: You have the right to access your stored data, rectification of inaccurate data, deletion of your data, restriction of processing, data portability, and the right to object to processing. You may also lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority.

sections.title: 8. Data Security
sections.content: We implement technical and organizational security measures to protect your data against accidental or intentional manipulation, loss, destruction, or access by unauthorized persons. These include SSL encryption, regular security updates, and access controls.

sections.title: 9. Cookies
sections.content: We use cookies to make our website user-friendly. Details can be found in our Cookie Policy.

sections.title: 10. Changes to the Privacy Policy
sections.content: We reserve the right to adapt this Privacy Policy as needed to reflect changes in legal requirements or changes to our services or data processing.

sections.title: 11. Contact
sections.content: If you have questions about data protection, please contact us via our contact form or by email.

cookiePolicyContent.intro: This Cookie Policy explains how ZeitPal uses cookies and similar technologies when you visit our website.

sections.title: 1. What Are Cookies?
sections.content: Cookies are small text files that are stored on your device when you visit a website. They allow the website to recognize your device and store various information.

sections.title: 2. What Cookies Do We Use?
sections.content: We use different types of cookies:

sections.title: 2.1 Necessary Cookies
sections.content: These cookies are essential for the basic functions of the website. They enable navigation, login, and access to secure areas. Without these cookies, the website cannot function properly.

sections.title: 2.2 Functional Cookies
sections.content: These cookies enable enhanced features such as saving your language preferences or remembering your login details. They improve user experience.

sections.title: 2.3 Analytics Cookies
sections.content: These cookies allow us to understand how visitors use our website. The collected data is anonymized and helps us improve our website.

sections.title: 3. Managing Cookie Settings
sections.content: You can adjust your cookie preferences at any time via the cookie settings in the footer of our website. You can also block or delete cookies in your browser settings. Note that disabling certain cookies may affect website functionality.

sections.title: 4. Storage Duration
sections.content: Storage duration varies depending on the type of cookie. Session cookies are deleted when you close your browser. Persistent cookies remain on your device for a specified period or until you delete them.

sections.title: 5. Third-Party Cookies
sections.content: In some cases, we use cookies from trusted third parties. These cookies are subject to the privacy policies of the respective providers.

sections.title: 6. Updates to This Policy
sections.content: We may update this Cookie Policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices or for other operational, legal, or regulatory reasons.

sections.title: 7. Contact
sections.content: If you have questions about our use of cookies, please contact us via our contact form or by email.

personio.name: Personio
personio.overview:
Personio is a comprehensive HR software platform founded in Munich in 2015. It has grown to become one of Europe's leading HR tech companies, serving over 10,000 customers. Personio offers a full suite of HR tools including recruiting, onboarding, time tracking, payroll, and of course, absence management.

While Personio is an excellent choice for companies looking for an all-in-one HR solution, its comprehensive nature means it may be more than what smaller teams need. The platform is designed for companies ready to centralize all their HR processes in one place.

features.leaveManagement: Full absence management with approval workflows
features.sickLeave: Sick leave tracking with document upload
features.teamCalendar: Team absence calendar integrated with HR data
features.reporting: Comprehensive HR analytics and custom reports
features.integrations: 200+ integrations including Slack, MS Teams, payroll systems

pricing.summary: Personio uses custom pricing based on company size and required modules. Expect to pay €3-8 per employee per month for Core HR, with additional costs for extra modules. No free tier available.

personio.targetAudience: Personio is ideal for mid-sized companies (50-2000 employees) looking to consolidate all HR processes in one platform. It's particularly well-suited for German companies needing comprehensive HR software with strong compliance features. However, for teams primarily focused on leave management, Personio may offer more functionality than needed.
pros: Strong GDPR compliance and German focus
cons: Can be complex for simple leave management needs
May be overkill for small teams
Long implementation time for full platform
personio.gdprCompliance: Personio is fully GDPR compliant with data stored in EU data centers. As a German company, they have strong expertise in European data protection requirements. They offer features like data retention policies, access controls, and audit logs.
personio.support: Personio offers email and phone support with German-speaking agents. Enterprise customers get dedicated account managers. They also provide an extensive help center and regular webinars for training.
personio.verdict: Personio is an excellent choice if you need a comprehensive HR platform that goes beyond leave management. However, if your primary need is simple, affordable leave tracking, ZeitPal offers a more focused solution with a free tier for small teams. Choose Personio for full HR suite, choose ZeitPal for straightforward leave management.

faqItems.question: Is Personio better than ZeitPal for leave management?
faqItems.answer: Personio offers more comprehensive HR features, but ZeitPal is specifically designed for leave management with a simpler interface and free tier for small teams. If you only need leave management, ZeitPal is more cost-effective.

faqItems.question: Can I migrate from Personio to ZeitPal?
faqItems.answer: Yes, you can export your absence data from Personio and import it into ZeitPal. Our support team can help with the migration process.

faqItems.question: Does Personio have a free version?
faqItems.answer: No, Personio does not offer a free tier. ZeitPal is free for teams up to 20 employees.

personizer.name: Personizer
personizer.tagline: German time tracking and absence management
personizer.overview:
Personizer is a German cloud-based HR tool focused on time tracking and absence management for small and medium-sized companies. Founded in 2015, they've built a reputation for GDPR compliance and ease of use.

Personizer combines time tracking with absence management, making it a good choice for companies that need both functionalities. Their focus on the German market means strong compliance with local labor laws.

pricing.summary: Personizer offers a free tier for up to 5 users. Paid plans start at around €2 per user per month. Transparent pricing with no hidden costs.

personizer.targetAudience: Personizer is designed for small to medium German companies that need combined time tracking and absence management. It's particularly suitable for teams that want simple, GDPR-compliant software without enterprise complexity.
pros: German company with strong GDPR compliance
Free tier available for small teams
Combined time tracking and absence management
cons: Free tier limited to 5 users (vs ZeitPal's 20)
Smaller company with less support resources
personizer.gdprCompliance: Personizer is fully GDPR compliant with data stored on ISO-certified servers in the EU. As a German company, they prioritize data protection and offer strong security measures.
personizer.support: Personizer offers email support in German and English. They provide a help center and documentation for self-service support.
personizer.verdict: Personizer and ZeitPal are both solid choices for German companies. The main differences are: ZeitPal offers a more generous free tier (20 users vs 5), while Personizer includes time tracking. If time tracking is important, consider Personizer. For pure leave management with a better free offering, ZeitPal is the better choice.

faqItems.question: What's the difference between Personizer and ZeitPal?
faqItems.answer: Both are German GDPR-compliant solutions. Personizer combines time tracking with absence management, while ZeitPal focuses specifically on leave management. ZeitPal offers a free tier for up to 20 users, compared to Personizer's 5 user limit.

faqItems.question: Which is cheaper, Personizer or ZeitPal?
faqItems.answer: For teams up to 20 employees, ZeitPal is completely free. Personizer's free tier is limited to 5 users. For paid plans, both are similarly priced around €2-4 per user per month.

Breathe HR is a UK-based HR software designed specifically for small and medium businesses. Founded in 2012, they've built a reputation for simple, affordable HR management that doesn't require HR expertise to use.

The platform offers a range of HR tools including absence management, document storage, performance management, and recruitment. Their focus is on simplicity and ease of use for SMEs.

pricing.summary: Breathe HR pricing starts at £13 per month for up to 10 employees, then per-user pricing applies. No free tier available.

breathehr.targetAudience: Breathe HR is designed for UK SMEs with 1-250 employees looking for simple HR software. It's particularly popular with companies without dedicated HR teams.
cons: UK-focused, not ideal for German companies
breathehr.gdprCompliance: Breathe HR is GDPR compliant with UK data centers. They provide standard data protection features for UK businesses.
breathehr.support: Breathe HR offers phone and email support with UK-based team. They have a help center and provide onboarding support.
breathehr.verdict: Breathe HR is a solid choice for UK SMEs wanting simple HR software. However, for German companies, ZeitPal is clearly the better choice with its German labor law support, GDPR focus, and free tier. Choose Breathe for UK businesses, choose ZeitPal for German companies.

faqItems.question: Can German companies use Breathe HR?
faqItems.answer: While possible, Breathe HR is designed for UK employment law. German companies would be better served by ZeitPal, which is built specifically for German requirements.

faqItems.question: Is Breathe HR available in German?
faqItems.answer: Breathe HR is primarily available in English. ZeitPal offers full German language support and is designed for the German market.

leapsome.name: Leapsome
leapsome.overview:
Leapsome is a Berlin-based people enablement platform founded in 2016. Unlike traditional HR software, Leapsome focuses on performance management, employee engagement, OKRs, and learning. While they do offer time tracking, absence management is not their primary focus.

The platform is known for its modern approach to people management and is popular with tech companies and startups looking to build strong performance cultures.

features.leaveManagement: Basic time off tracking (not primary focus)
features.sickLeave: Available as part of time tracking
features.integrations: HRIS, Slack, MS Teams, Google, BambooHR

pricing.summary: Leapsome uses modular pricing. Expect €6-15 per user per month depending on modules selected. Time tracking is an add-on module.

leapsome.targetAudience: Leapsome is designed for companies focused on building high-performance cultures with emphasis on goals, feedback, and development. Best for tech companies and startups prioritizing people development over administrative HR.
cons: Absence management is not the focus
Can be expensive for just leave management
Time off is an add-on, not core feature
leapsome.gdprCompliance: Leapsome is a German company with strong GDPR compliance. Data is stored in EU data centers and they provide comprehensive data protection features.
leapsome.support: Leapsome provides dedicated customer success managers, email support, and comprehensive documentation. Training and onboarding support included.
leapsome.verdict: Leapsome is an excellent choice for companies prioritizing performance management and people development. However, for dedicated leave management, ZeitPal is the better fit with its focused features and free tier. Choose Leapsome for performance culture, choose ZeitPal for leave management.

faqItems.question: Can I use Leapsome just for leave management?
faqItems.answer: While possible, Leapsome's strength is in performance management. For dedicated leave management, ZeitPal offers a more focused and cost-effective solution.

faqItems.question: Is Leapsome German?
faqItems.answer: Yes, Leapsome is a Berlin-based company. However, their focus is on global performance management rather than German-specific leave management like ZeitPal.

clockodo.name: Clockodo
clockodo.overview:
Clockodo is a German time tracking software founded in 2011. While primarily known for project-based time tracking, they also offer absence management features. The platform is popular with agencies, consultancies, and service companies that need to track billable hours.

Clockodo combines time tracking with absence management and offers integration with DATEV for German payroll processing.

features.leaveManagement: Absence management as part of time tracking
features.sickLeave: Sick leave recording with time tracking
features.reporting: Time and absence reports, DATEV export

pricing.summary: Clockodo pricing is based on active users. Plans start at €6.50 per user per month. They offer a 14-day free trial but no permanent free tier.

clockodo.targetAudience: Clockodo is designed for German service companies, agencies, and consultancies that need project-based time tracking alongside absence management. Best suited for companies with billable hours.
pros: Good for agencies and service companies
cons: More expensive than dedicated leave tools
May be complex if you don't need time tracking
clockodo.gdprCompliance: Clockodo is a German company with full GDPR compliance. Data is stored on German servers and they offer DATEV integration for German accounting requirements.
clockodo.support: Clockodo provides German-language support via email and phone. They have a comprehensive help center and offer personal onboarding.
clockodo.verdict: Clockodo is an excellent choice for German service companies needing project-based time tracking with absence management. However, if your primary need is leave management without time tracking, ZeitPal offers a more focused and cost-effective solution with a free tier. Choose Clockodo for time tracking, choose ZeitPal for leave management.

faqItems.question: Should I use Clockodo or ZeitPal?
faqItems.answer: If you need project-based time tracking for billable hours, choose Clockodo. If you primarily need leave and absence management, choose ZeitPal. ZeitPal is also free for up to 20 employees.

faqItems.question: Does Clockodo integrate with German payroll?
faqItems.answer: Yes, Clockodo offers DATEV integration for German payroll. ZeitPal focuses on leave management rather than payroll integration.

absentify.name: absentify
absentify.overview:
absentify is an Austrian leave management tool specifically designed for Microsoft Teams. Founded in 2020, they've focused on providing a seamless absence management experience within the Teams ecosystem.

The platform offers tight integration with Microsoft 365, allowing employees to manage leave without leaving their familiar Teams environment.

pricing.summary: absentify offers a limited free tier. Paid plans start at €2 per user per month. Transparent pricing with no hidden costs.

absentify.targetAudience: absentify is designed for companies using Microsoft Teams as their primary communication tool. Best suited for organizations wanting leave management embedded in their Microsoft 365 ecosystem.
cons: Requires Microsoft Teams to be useful
Newer company with smaller customer base
Less comprehensive than full HR solutions
absentify.gdprCompliance: absentify is GDPR compliant as an Austrian company. They use Microsoft Azure infrastructure for data storage and processing.
absentify.support: absentify provides email support and documentation. Being a smaller company, support resources are more limited but responsive.
absentify.verdict: absentify is a great choice for Teams-heavy organizations wanting embedded leave management. However, for German companies needing standalone leave management with specific labor law compliance, ZeitPal offers a more comprehensive solution. Choose absentify for Microsoft Teams integration, choose ZeitPal for standalone German leave management.

faqItems.question: Do I need Microsoft Teams for absentify?
faqItems.answer: While absentify has a web interface, its primary value is the Teams integration. Without Teams, ZeitPal offers a more comprehensive standalone experience.

faqItems.question: Is absentify cheaper than ZeitPal?
faqItems.answer: Both offer free tiers. For small teams, ZeitPal's free tier (up to 20 users) may be more generous. For paid plans, both are similarly priced around €2-4 per user per month.
